newsitem.title: USA: AEP Industries closes Massachusetts plant.
newsitem.headline: AEP Industries closes Massachusetts plant.

text.p: AEP Industries Inc said Thursday it ceased manufacturing operations at a plant in Massachusetts, resulting in the elimination of 320 jobs during the next four months.
The company said it also would eliminate an additional 40 administrative and sales positions, most of which are based at the plant in North Andover, Mass.
The plant was formerly part of Borden Inc's global packaging division, acquired by AEP earlier this month. The plant manufactures pallet wrap and polyvinyl chloride film products.
The company said its other facilities have "ample capacity" to serve customers formerly supplied by the North Andover plant.
AEP said it expected the plant closing will save about $18 million in the 1997 fiscal year. It did not anticipate any further plant consolidations in North America.
AEP spokeswoman Catherine Feeney said the company plans to take a charge for costs related to the layoffs, such as severance pay. The charge will be taken "in the next four months."
It was not immediately known how large of a charge the company would take, she said.
